title: 114_hr551
content: The Act may be cited as the "IDEA Full Funding Act" and includes an amendment to IDEA. Section 611(i) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (20 U.S.C. 1411(i)) is amended to specify funding amounts for fiscal year 2016, with $12,872,421,000 or 17.7 percent of the determined amount for certain purposes, and $1,374,573,000 or 1.6 percent for other purposes. For fiscal year 2017, $2,913,478,000 or 3.3 percent of the determined amount is appropriated, with $16,134,207,000 or 21.2 percent allocated for fiscal year 2018. For fiscal years 2018 to 2020, specific amounts are appropriated, with funds becoming available on July 1 of each year and remaining available through September 30 of the following year. For fiscal year 2020, $8,724,659,000 or 9.3 percent of the determined amount is available for obligation from July 1, 2020, through September 30, 2021. For fiscal year 2021, $22,640,117,000 or 27.8 percent of the determined amount is available, with $11,142,269,000 appropriated for obligation from July 1, 2021, through September 30, 2022. $25,346,755,000 or 30.5 percent of the amount is also allocated. For fiscal year 2022, $25,346,755,000 or 30.5 percent of the determined amount is appropriated, with $13,848,907,000 becoming available on July 1, 2022, and remaining accessible through September 30, 2023. For fiscal year 2023, $28,376,972,000 or 33.4 percent of the determined amount is allocated, with $16,879,124,000 becoming available. For fiscal year 2023, $31,769,453,000 or 36.5 percent of the determined amount is appropriated, with $20,271,605,000 becoming available on July 1, 2023, and remaining accessible through September 30, 2024. For fiscal year 2024, $35,567,506,000 or 40 percent of the determined amount is allocated, with the same availability for subsequent fiscal years. For fiscal year 2025 and onwards, $35,567,506,000 or 40% of the determined amount is appropriated, becoming available on July 1 of each fiscal year and remaining accessible through September 30 of the following year. The amount determined under this paragraph is based on the total number of children with disabilities who received special education services in the previous school year and the average per-pupil expenditure in public schools. The average per-pupil expenditure in public elementary and secondary schools in the United States is determined based on the total number of children with disabilities who received special education services in the previous school year. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. The amounts appropriated in 611(i) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act shall be expended consistent with pay-as-you-go requirements.
